Basic Queries¶

class countries.base.queries.BasicCountryQueries¶

Defines basic queries for class CountryRepository.

abstract get_average_population() → float¶

Returns the value of the average population.

Returns:

the average population

abstract get_count_of_countries_of_region(region: Region) → int¶

Returns the count of countries that are located in the given continent.

Parameters:

region – the continent

Returns:

the count of countries

abstract get_count_of_european_countries() → int¶

Returns the count of European countries.

Returns:

the count of countries

abstract get_countries_below_population_limit(limit: int) → set[countries.base.model.Country]¶

Returns the set of countries which population is less than the given limit.

Parameters:

limit – the limit

Returns:

the set of countries

abstract get_countries_by_population(lower_bound: int, upper_bound: Optional[int] = None) → set[countries.base.model.Country]¶

Returns each country which has a population which is between the given bounds (inclusive).

Parameters:

  • lower_bound – the lower bound

  • upper_bound – the upper bound (optional)

Returns:

the set of countries

abstract get_country_by_code(code: str) → Optional[Country]¶

Returns the country which has the given code.

Parameters:

code – the country code

Returns:

the country

abstract get_distinct_capitals() → set[str]¶

Returns a set containing all the distinct capitals.

Returns:

the capitals

abstract get_distinct_names() → set[str]¶

Returns a set containing all the distinct country names;

Returns:

the names

abstract get_distinct_populations_by_region(region: Region) → set[int]¶

Returns all the population values that belong to the given continent.

Parameters:

region – the continent

Returns:

the set of populations

abstract get_first_country_by_starting_letter(letter: str) → Optional[Country]¶

Returns the first country which name starts with the given letter.

Parameters:

letter – the letter

Returns:

the country

abstract get_greatest_population() → int¶

Returns the value of the greatest population.

Returns:

the greatest population

abstract get_most_populous_country_by_region(region: Region) → Country¶

Returns the country which has the greatest population of its continent.

Parameters:

region – the continent

Returns:

the country

abstract get_population_by_region(region: Region) → int¶

Returns the population of the given continent.

Parameters:

region – the continent

Returns:

the population

abstract is_population_exists(population: int) → bool¶

Returns whether a country exists having the given population.

Parameters:

population – the population

Returns:

the result

Sorting Queries¶

class countries.base.queries.SortingCountryQueries¶

Defines sorting queries for class CountryRepository.

abstract get_capitals_order_by_name_desc() → list[str]¶

Returns the capital of each country in descending order.

Returns:

the capitals

abstract get_countries_order_by_length_of_capital_then_by_capital() → list[countries.base.model.Country]¶

Returns the list of countries ordered by:

  • the length of the names of their capitals

  • their capitals

Returns:

the sorted list of countries

abstract get_countries_order_by_length_of_capital_then_by_population_desc() → list[countries.base.model.Country]¶

Returns the list of countries ordered by:

  • the names of their capitals

  • their population in descending order

Returns:

the sorted list of countries

abstract get_countries_order_by_population_desc() → list[countries.base.model.Country]¶

Returns the list of countries ordered by:

  • their populations in descending order

Returns:

the sorted list of countries

Aggregation Queries¶

class countries.base.queries.AggregationCountryQueries¶

Defines queries for class CountryRepository that deal with aggregation.

abstract get_count_of_countries_by_regions() → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, int]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each region to the count of its countries.

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_countries_by_codes() → dict[str, countries.base.model.Country]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each country code to the corresponding country.

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_countries_by_first_letters_and_regions() → dict[str, dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, set[countries.base.model.Country]]]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps the letters that occur in the first place of corresponding country names to regions, then each letter to the corresponding countries.

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_countries_by_regions() → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, set[countries.base.model.Country]]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each region to its countries.

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_countries_by_regions_and_codes() → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, dict[str, countries.base.model.Country]]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each region to the corresponding country codes, then each country code to the corresponding country.

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_countries_by_regions_and_first_letters() → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, dict[str, set[countries.base.model.Country]]]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps region to the letters that occur in the first place of corresponding country names, then each letter to the corresponding countries.

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_countries_by_regions_filter_by_population(lower_bound: int, upper_bound: int) → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, set[countries.base.model.Country]]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each region to the corresponding countries which population is between the given bounds (inclusive) to their continent.

Parameters:

  • lower_bound – the lower bound

  • upper_bound – the upper bound

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_countries_by_regions_order_by_capitals() → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, list[countries.base.model.Country]]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each region the list of its countries ordered by their capital names to their continent.

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_first_localized_countries_by_regions(locale: str) → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, countries.base.model.Country]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each region to the country which name is the first in the given locale.

Parameters:

locale – the locale

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_first_localized_country_names_by_regions(locale: str) → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, str]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each region to the country name which is the first in the given locale.

Parameters:

locale – the locale

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_localized_country_names_by_regions(locale: str) → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, set[str]]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each region to the set of country names, using the given locale.

Parameters:

locale – the locale

Returns:

the dictionary

abstract get_most_populous_country_by_regions() → dict[countries.base.model.Country.Region, countries.base.model.Country]¶

Returns a dictionary which maps each region to its most populous country.

Returns:

the dictionary
